hypothesis_content.title: BTC Volatility Compression Breakout Momentum
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC's 7-day realized volatility falls below its 30-day average by more than 25% (compression) during a NEUTRAL regime, the subsequent breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band will lead to a momentum move where BTC outperforms ETH by at least 3% over the next 5 trading days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended volatility compression in neutral markets often precedes significant directional moves. A breakout from compression tends to attract momentum traders and short covering. The BTC/ETH ratio target captures alpha from BTC leading major moves.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std dev)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC/ETH ratio increases by 3% from entry
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price closes below 20-day moving average

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Breakout fails to sustain, BTC/ETH ratio declines or remains flat while volatility expands asymmetrically to the downside.
